Stabbing victim is city's fifth homicide in four days

A 25-year-old man was fatally stabbed near the Dudley MBTA bus stop after “words were exchanged on a bus,” a T spokesman said. (Boston Globe, 5:40 p.m.)

Red Sox manager Bobby Valentine declined to elaborate on what was said between him and second baseman Dustin Pedroia during a moment in the dugout before Tuesday's game in Baltimore. (Globe, 4:20 p.m.)

State confirms human West Nile case

News

Clashes continue in Syrian capital

Activists say Syrian troops have clashed with rebels near the government headquarters and Iranian embassy in the capital Damascus. The Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights had no immediate word on casualties.
